New Records: Albania's Klaus Gjasula scored the latest equalizing goal in European Championship history (excluding extra-time)
Klaus Gjasula became the first substitute to score a goal and an own goal in a match at the UEFA European Championship
Croatia's Luka Modric completed 108 passes, the most by an older player in a single EURO 2024 match
Croatia's Luka Modric was the oldest player on record to complete 100+ passes in a FIFA World Cup match
Croatia's 67% possession was their highest ever recorded in a single major international tournament match
Key Match Events: Albania scored the earliest goal in European Championship history
Croatia struggled to create chances, with only 0.25 expected goals (xG) in the first half
Albania equalized in the 94th minute with Klaus Gjasula's own goal
Croatia's Andrej Kramaric scored on his birthday, joining an elite group of players to do so at the EURO
The game was the first at EURO 2024 to see both teams score at least twice
Albania had their first point of the tournament after two spirited performances
Pre-Game Insights: Croatia's manager Zlatko Dalic made three changes to his side, prioritizing experience
Croatia's average starting age was 30 years and one day, the second-oldest team in tournament history
Post-Match Reflections: Croatia's manager Zlatko Dalic expressed frustration at the late equalizer
Luka Modric's performance highlighted his importance despite the loss
Albania's manager Sylvinho praised his team's resilience and spirit
The result left Group B wide open, with Croatia needing a win against Italy to progress
Miscellaneous Highlights: Albania had 31% possession but twice as many shots (8 vs 4) and more than three times the expected goals (0.86 vs 0.25) of Croatia
The match was the first to see both teams score at least twice in EURO 2024
This was Albania's first multi-goal match at a major tournament since 2002
Others: Heavy rain delayed the match by 30 minutes in a previous match, but not in this one
